StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: PsychENCODE Consortium: Epigenetic Dysregulation in Autism Spectrum Disorder

Policy.acknowledgement_statement:
Acknowledgement statement to be used for parent study phs001022.v1.p1, and sub-studies phs000872.v2.p1, phs001061.v1.p1, and phs001220.v1.p1:
Expression and epigenetic data from postmortem brain tissues from ASD cases or controls used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap through dbGaP study accession number phs001022.v1.p1. These data sets were generated and provided by the laboratories of Daniel H. Geschwind, Shyam Prabhakar, and Jonathan Mill. Daniel H. Geschwind, M.D., Ph.D. and collaborators request that publications resulting from these data cite their original publications: [PMIDs: 25525873; 27919067; 27863250]. Support for the collection of the data sets was provided by the NIH/NIMH (R01MH094714; R37 MH060233; R01MH100027) and Simons Foundation (206744).
Acknowledgment statement to be used for sub-study phs001190.v1.p1:
This work is a component of the PsychENCODE project and was supported by NIH grants to Daniel H. Geschwind (R01MH060233; R01MH100027; U01MH103339; R01MH110927; R01MH094714), Hyejung Won (K99MH113823), Glenn/AFAR Postdoctoral Fellowship Program (20145357) and Basic Science Research Program through the National Research Foundation of Korea (2013024227) to Hyejung Won. The Hi-C library was sequenced by the Broad Stem Cell Research Center (BSCRC) at UCLA, and fetal tissue was collected from the UCLA Center for Aids Research (CFAR, P30AI028697).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

StudyTo.name: dbGaP Collection: Compilation of Individual-Level Genomic Data for General Research Use
